steps.explanation: Keeping up to date with COVID-19 vaccinations is crucial, especially for older adults and individuals with underlying health conditions, as it significantly reduces the risk of severe illness.
Adhering to general preventive measures, such as mask-wearing and social distancing, is important, especially if you are older or have one or more health conditions.

citations.excerpt:
People with Certain Medical Conditions and COVID-19 Risk Factors
For Everyone
June 11, 2025
Español
What to know
• If you have any medical conditions listed below, you are more likely to get very sick
with COVID-19.
• This list does not include all conditions.
• If you have symptoms consistent with ...

steps.text: Seek treatment within 5-7 days of symptom onset.
steps.explanation: Initiating treatment early, within 5-7 days from when symptoms begin, is crucial. Early intervention can significantly decrease the risk of hospitalization and mortality associated with COVID-19.

steps.text: Consider visiting a Test to Treat location.
steps.explanation: Test to Treat locations offer a convenient way to get tested for COVID-19 and receive treatment, if eligible, in a single visit. These locations streamline the process of accessing timely care.

steps.text: Discuss COVID-19 vaccination with a healthcare provider.
steps.explanation: Parents of children aged 6 months to 17 years should consult with a healthcare provider to discuss the benefits and recommendations for COVID-19 vaccination. Vaccination is a key preventive measure.

steps.text: Discuss COVID-19 vaccination with a healthcare provider.
steps.explanation: Parents of children aged 6 months to 17 years should consult with a healthcare provider to discuss the benefits and recommendations for COVID-19 vaccination.
Refer to resources providing the latest information on COVID-19 vaccines to ensure you and your family are up to date with current recommendations and booster schedules.

steps.text: Consult your healthcare provider for personalized advice.
steps.explanation: If you have questions about specific medical conditions or how to manage them to protect yourself from COVID-19, contact your healthcare provider for tailored guidance.

steps.explanation: For immunocompromised individuals aged 12 and older, weighing at least 88 pounds, Pemivibart, a monoclonal antibody, can provide additional protection against COVID-19. It can be administered at least 2 weeks after COVID-19 vaccination.

steps.text: Consult healthcare provider about additional precautions.
steps.explanation: Immunocompromised individuals, even when vaccinated, might require extra preventive measures. Discuss specific needs and vulnerabilities with a healthcare professional to determine appropriate actions.

steps.text: Consider additional doses of updated COVID-19 vaccine.
steps.explanation: Moderately or severely immunocompromised individuals may benefit from additional doses of the updated COVID-19 vaccine. Monitor immune response following vaccination, and follow specific guidance for this population.

People who are immunocompromised or are taking medicines that weaken their immune
system may not be protected even if they are up to date on their vaccines. Examples
include:
• People who have cancer and are on chemotherapy
• People who have had a solid org...

steps.text: Consult healthcare provider about extra precautions.
steps.explanation: Immunocompromised individuals, even when vaccinated, might need additional preventive measures. Discuss specific risks and tailored strategies with a healthcare professional to enhance protection.

Moderately or severely immunocompromised individuals might benefit from extra doses of the updated COVID-19 vaccine. This is because their immune response to vaccination may differ from that of healthy individuals.

Individuals 12 years and older, weighing at least 88 pounds, and moderately or severely immunocompromised may be eligible for Pemivibart. This monoclonal antibody offers an additional layer of protection against COVID-19, supplementing vaccination.

steps.text: Administer Pemivibart at least 2 weeks post-vaccination.
steps.explanation: If eligible and deemed appropriate by a healthcare provider, administer Pemivibart at least two weeks after the patient has received a COVID-19 vaccine. This ensures optimal immune response and protection.

Continuously monitor emerging COVID-19 variants and their potential impact on Pemivibart's effectiveness. Stay updated with FDA's revisions to the Emergency Use Authorization materials for the latest guidance.
